question: 行う
sourceMnemonic: The meaning of this word is pretty strange, having very little to do with the kanji meaning you learned. This word means <vocabulary>to carry something out</vocabulary>. Maybe you can think of it like someone is saying "You (<ja>う</ja>) <kanji>go</kanji> do that task!" to get yourself <vocabulary>to carry out</vocabulary> the task. Whatever you do, just know this is a weird exception word, so you may have to do some extra work to remember it.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is also a strange exception. You have to remember the <ja>おこな</ja> portion. Maybe this mnemonic will help: You have <vocabulary>to carry out</vocabulary> a task but you're not too excited about it. Then you find out the task will bring you to Kona, Hawaii. "<reading>Oh, Kona!?</reading>" (<ja>おこな</ja>), you shout. In that case, you'll get right on it.

relatedVocab.ergativeTwin: 待って 猫ちゃん 行っちゃ嫌だ
